metadata.title: Passkey Wallet Creation
metadata.purpose: Demonstrate that passkey wallets replace seed phrase anxiety with device biometrics. Show the complete flow from button click to usable wallet in seconds.
metadata.viewer_takeaway: "I can create a crypto wallet with just my fingerprint - no seed phrases to write down, memorize, or lose."

scene.name: Wallet Creation UI
scene.narrative: Clean interface appears. The key signal: NO seed phrase warning anywhere. Traditional crypto onboarding starts with "write down these 12 words" anxiety. This UI deliberately omits that, signaling "this is different."
scene.viewer_should_notice: - "Create Wallet" button is the clear, single call-to-action - Feature badges: "Passkey secured", "Instant setup", "Self-custody" - Absence of seed phrase / recovery key mentions - Clean, trustworthy design language
scene.timing_rationale: Viewer needs to: - Read headline "Create Your Wallet" (1s) - Scan the 3 feature badges (1.5s) - Register this as a wallet creation screen (0.5s) Total: 3 seconds. Not the hero moment, but needs enough time to establish context before the key differentiator.

scene.name: Passkey Authentication
scene.narrative:
THIS IS THE HERO MOMENT. The entire point of the video.
Native OS biometric prompt appears - this is TouchID/FaceID, not a custom UI. The viewer must understand that device-level security is handling authentication. The "Creating secure passkey..." text explains what's happening.
This scene replaces what would be 2-3 minutes of seed phrase ceremony in traditional flows.
scene.viewer_should_notice: - Native system dialog (not app UI) - proves this is real device security - "Creating secure passkey..." explanatory text - Fingerprint scanning animation - something is happening - Success checkmark - confirmation it worked - The ENTIRE security setup is just this - no backup steps follow
scene.timing_rationale:
This is the key differentiator. Rushing it defeats the video's purpose. Viewer needs: 1. Recognize the biometric prompt as system-level (1s) - If too fast, looks like a custom modal, not real security 2. Read "Creating secure passkey..." (1.5s) - This text explains what's happening 3. Watch scanning animation (2s) - Proves work is happening, builds anticipation 4. See and register success state (1.5s) - Must feel like completion, not a flash
Total: 6 seconds MINIMUM.
Giving this less time is the #1 mistake - the viewer won't understand what makes this special.

scene.name: Wallet Ready
scene.narrative:
Payoff: wallet exists and has an address. The viewer should feel "wow, that's it? That was easy."
Implicit comparison: traditional flow would have taken 5 minutes of careful word transcription. This took 10 seconds.
scene.viewer_should_notice: - Success checkmark animation - "Wallet Created!" confirmation headline - Actual wallet address displayed (proof it worked) - Implicit: ready to receive funds immediately, no more steps
scene.timing_rationale:
Let the success moment breathe. This is emotional payoff. - Success animation registers (0.5s) - Read "Wallet Created!" (0.5s) - See wallet address as proof (1s) - Moment to feel "that was easy" (1s)
Total: 3 seconds. Don't rush the ending - it's the lasting impression.

transition.description: Button shows press state (scale down slightly), then biometric dialog fades in as button click triggers the system prompt. Cursor hides after click - user is not controlling the biometric.
Biometric dialog fades out while success card slides up from below. Overlapping fade creates smooth handoff.
